basics.name: Patricia Wong
basics.label: Materials and Process Engineer
basics.summary: I am a Engineer with a background in materials and processes. Bachelors in Mechanical Engineering and currently completed a Data Analytics and Visualization Boot Camp at the University of Miami expanding my skills in Python with Pandas, Matplotlib, SQL, Javascript, Tableau, and Excel. I have the ability and determination to learn effectively, solve problems creatively, and keep up with changing demands. A diligent problem solver with a love of learning, looking to start a new career.

skills.name: Software Skills
keywords: Microsoft Office (Microsoft Word, Advanced Excel, and PowerPoint)

skills.name: Electronic Packaging and Multilayer Ceramic Technology
keywords: Extensive experience in screen printing, slurry preparation and tape casting.

skills.name: Microfabrication Processing
keywords: etching  (wet and dry plasma etching and RIE).

summary: Developed processes for multilayer ceramics manufacturing of hermetic co-fired ceramic feedthroughs
Performed micro-fabrication processes to make flexible components for an implantable medical device (a visual prosthesis)
Completed prototype of the retinal prothesis
highlights: Tracked and managed project schedule with Gantt charts
Patents, Grant Applications, and IP Portfolio - communicated with attorneys and team members
Managed projects by coordinating customer needs with vendors and research team
Procurement and set up ISO 8 Cleanroom in the main Bionic Eye laboratory space
Troubleshoot software, hardware and networking issues over the phone
Answer phone and email responses to the ITS Help Desk

volunteer.organization: Center for Renewable Energy and Island Sustainability
volunteer.summary: Lead developer for weather sensing project
highlights: Design firmware for distributed weather sensor network
Maintain custom data collection and storage infrastructure
Webmaster/IT Officer, IEEE Student Branch, UH Manoa, 2012-2013

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.
